title.value: Development of a Novel Dosimetry Software for Patient-Specific Intravascular Brachytherapy Treatment Planning on Optical Coherence Tomography Images
title.justification: The title clearly states the focus of the research, which is the development of a novel dosimetry software specific for intravascular brachytherapy treatment, utilizing Optical Coherence Tomography images.
title.quote: Development of a Novel Dosimetry Software for Patient-Specific Intravascular Brachytherapy Treatment Planning on Optical Coherence Tomography Images

extractions.description: The paper discusses the development of a Monte Carlo simulation-based dosimetry software to improve patient-specific treatment planning for intravascular brachytherapy using Optical Coherence Tomography images, accounting for patient-specific geometry and heterogeneities.

type.justification: The paper involves the empirical development and testing of a software tool using Monte Carlo simulations, as indicated by the detailed description of methods and results.
type.quote: Monte Carlo treatment planning software based on the Geant4 toolkit v. 10.02.p02 was developed.

name.justification: The research focuses on developing dosimetry software for radiotherapy treatment planning, which falls under the domain of Medical Physics.
name.quote: Development of a Novel Dosimetry Software for Patient-Specific Intravascular Brachytherapy Treatment.

name.justification: The study is centered around enhancing treatment planning in the field of Intravascular Brachytherapy, which is a form of Radiation Therapy.
name.quote: Intravascular brachytherapy (IVBT) is a modality of radiation therapy used to treat in-stent restenosis.

name.justification: The research utilizes Optical Coherence Tomography, an imaging technique, for treatment planning.
name.quote: Vascular optical coherence tomography (OCT) is an imaging modality that utilizes near-infrared light to image the IVBT treatment area.

name.justification: Monte Carlo simulations were explicitly used for treatment planning and dosimetry calculations.
name.quote: Monte Carlo treatment planning software based on the Geant4 toolkit v. 10.02.p02 was developed.

is_contributed.justification: The Monte Carlo Simulation is a well-established technique and not novel to this study.
is_contributed.quote: Monte Carlo treatment planning software based on the Geant4 toolkit v. 10.02.p02 was developed.

is_executed.justification: The simulations were executed as part of developing and testing the dosimetry software.
is_executed.quote: Simulations were performed on the Digital Research Alliance of Canada Narval computing cluster with 1 billion decay events to yield less than 1% uncertainty on absorbed dose in the target volume.

is_compared.justification: Results from the Monte Carlo simulations were compared against water-based dosimetry calculations.
is_compared.quote: The absorbed dose was scored in rectangular voxels of 0.05 mm by 0.05 mm.

name.value: Optical Coherence Tomography Images (Brigham and Women’s Hospital)
name.justification: The study utilizes OCT images from patients for developing the dosimetry software.
name.quote: OCT images from a patient at Brigham and Women’s Hospital in Boston, Mas-sachusetts undergoing coronary IVBT for recurrent ISR, were used.
